text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.

section.section:
"Alcoholic beverage" means a spirituous, vinous, malt, or fermented liquor, liquid, or compound that:
is fit for beverage purposes; and
contains one-half of 1% or more of alcohol by volume.

"Alcoholic beverage" includes:
beer;
distilled spirits; and
wine.

text.section: "Alcoholic beverage license" means an alcoholic beverage license or permit issued under Article 2B of the Code.
"Consumer" means a person who buys, possesses, or transports an alcoholic beverage for a purpose other than selling the alcoholic beverage.
"Direct wine shipper" has the meaning stated in Article 2B, § 7.5-101 of the Code.

section.section: "Distilled spirits" means a distilled alcoholic beverage.

text.section: "Manufacturer" means a person who operates within the State a place of business for blending, bottling, brewing, distilling, fermenting, or rectifying an alcoholic beverage.
"Nonresident dealer" means a person who is required to obtain a nonresident dealer's permit under Article 2B, § 2-101(i) of the Code.

"Person" includes:
this State or a political subdivision, unit, or instrumentality of this State;
another state or a political subdivision, unit, or instrumentality of that state; and
a unit or instrumentality of a political subdivision of this State or of another state.
"Resident dealer" means a person who is required to obtain a resident dealer's permit under Article 2B, § 2-101(w) of this Code.

section.section: "Retail dealer" means a person who buys an alcoholic beverage for sale to a consumer.
"Retail dealer" includes a county department of liquor control or liquor control board that operates a dispensary.

text.section: "Tax stamp" means a device in the design and denomination that the Comptroller authorizes for the purpose of being affixed to a container of distilled spirits as evidence that the alcoholic beverage tax is paid.

section.section: "Wholesaler" means a person who buys or imports an alcoholic beverage for sale to another person for resale.
"Wholesaler" includes a county department of liquor control or liquor control board that operates a wholesale dispensary.
